title: Why your insurer's definition of a 'storm' could damage your payout
text:
Homeowners left with damaged properties after bad weather may find their insurance claims are rejected because of insurers’ definitions of a storm.

Buildings insurance promises to pay out for damage to homes caused by bad weather such as the recent Storm Lorenzo.

However, for a claim to be valid it must be the result of weather so severe that insurers could not deny it was a storm. Damage caused by bad weather below this threshold is likely to be deemed the result of poor property maintenance and any claims rejected.
